title: Chris Lilley says he's open to giving Mr G his own spin-off
text:
He's one of the country's most recognisable small screen stars, with hits like We Can Be Heroes and Lunatics.

And now Chris Lilley, 44, has revealed he'd happily give his beloved Summer Heights High character his very own spin-off.

The comic genius was answering questions on Reddit, when one person inquired if he would ever consider giving his beloved character Mr G his own spin-off series.

'They all come back eventually!' Comic genius Chris Lilley (pictured) said he's open to giving Mr G his very own spin-off... before he revealed 'there's something new on the way'

'Yeah, probs,' replied Chris. 'They’ll all come back eventually.'

In the same thread, another fan asked the Sydney-born comic who his favourite character of all time was, which prompted a cryptic response.

'There’s something new on the way. But can’t say yet,' he said.

Sexy in mauve: Since rising to fame with the internationally acclaimed comedy series We Can Be Heroes in 2005, Chris has produced and starred Summer Heights High, Angry Boys, Ja'mie: Private School Girl and Jonah From Tonga. Pictured as Mr G

Since rising to fame with the internationally acclaimed comedy series We Can Be Heroes back in 2005, Chris has produced and starred Summer Heights High, Angry Boys, Ja'mie: Private School Girl and Jonah From Tonga.

In 2019, Lunatics became the second Australian production streaming service Netflix has created for its paying customers globally.

But success hasn't come easy for the notoriously shy star.

In May this year, he told The Past Weekend podcast with Theo Vonn that he finds fame 'scary'.

'I can't get my head around the interest in it,' Chris said.

'I go to TV award nights and I think, "What am I doing here. I'm not part of this. Who are these people?" It genuinely isn't my thing.'
